# Administrative Boundaries 

Country and lower level administrative divisions' boundaries

- Data : [`rgeoboundaries`](https://github.com/wmgeolab/rgeoboundaries) R-package

.panelset[
.panel[.panel-name[Map]

```{r admin-boundaries, out.width='100%', fig.height=4, eval=T}
library(rgeoboundaries)
library(leaflet)
# Administrative Level 1 boundaries of Nigeria and Chad
nigeria_chad_admlvl1_boundaries <- geoboundaries(c("Nigeria", "Chad"), "adm1")

nigeria_chad_admlvl1_boundaries %>% leaflet() %>% 
  addTiles() %>% 
  addPolygons(label = nigeria_chad_admlvl1_boundaries$shapeName)
```

]
.panel[.panel-name[Code]

```{r admin-boundaries, eval = F, echo = T}
```

]
]

# Open Street Map 

Hospitals in Lagos, the largest city in Nigeria

- Data : [`osmdata`](https://github.com/ropensci/osmdata) R-package

.panelset[
.panel[.panel-name[Map]

```{r osm-data, out.width='100%', fig.height=4, eval=T}
library(osmdata)
library(leaflet)

# creating bounding box for Lagos
lagos_bb <- getbb("Lagos")

# retrieving data of hospitals in Lagos
lagos_hospitals <- lagos_bb %>%
  opq() %>%
  add_osm_feature("amenity", "hospital") %>%
  osmdata_sf()

leaflet() %>% 
  addTiles() %>% 
  addPolygons(data = lagos_hospitals$osm_polygons,
              label = lagos_hospitals$osm_polygons$name)
```

]
.panel[.panel-name[Code]

```{r osm-data, eval = F, echo = T}
```

]
]

# Population

Choropleth maps and Cartograms visualising both country level and lower administrative division level population

- Data : [`wopr`](https://github.com/wpgp/wopr) R-package

.panelset[
.panel[.panel-name[Choropleth Map]

```{r choropleth-map, out.height="300px", eval=T}
knitr::include_graphics("images/choropleth.PNG", dpi=NA)
```

]
.panel[.panel-name[Code]

```{r choropleth-code, eval = F, echo = T}
library(sf)
library(here)
library(ggplot2)

## please follow tutorial at https://rspatialdata.github.io/population.html to download and tidy data

admin_level3_shape <- st_read(here::here("wopr/NGA/population/v1.2/NGA_population_v1_2_admin/NGA_population_v1_2_admin_level3_boundaries.shp"))

admin_level3_shape %>% 
  ggplot(aes(fill = mean)) +
  geom_sf() +
  labs(title = "Choropleth map of population in Nigeria",
       subtitle = "Administrative level 3 divisions") +
  xlab("Longitude") +
  ylab("Latitude") +
  scale_fill_continuous(name = "Population")
```

]
.panel[.panel-name[Cartogram]

```{r cartogram, out.height="300px", eval=T}
knitr::include_graphics("images/cartogram.PNG", dpi = NA)
```

]
.panel[.panel-name[Code]

```{r cartogram-code, eval = F, echo = T}
library(sf)
library(here)
library(cartogram)
library(ggplot2)

## please follow tutorial at https://rspatialdata.github.io/population.html to download and tidy data

admin_level2_sf <- st_read(here::here("wopr/NGA/population/v1.2/NGA_population_v1_2_admin/NGA_population_v1_2_admin_level2_boundaries.shp"))

# transforming the coordinates of the object to a new reference system.
# while we have used a tranformation with EPSG code 2311, specific for Nigeria, codes for other countries can be found at https://epsg.io/
admin_level2_transformed <- st_transform(admin_level2_sf, crs = 2311)

# creating the cartogram
admin_level2_cartogram <- cartogram_cont(admin_level2_transformed, "mean", itermax=5)

# visualising the created cartogram
ggplot() +
  geom_sf(data = admin_level2_cartogram, aes(fill = mean)) +
  labs(title = "Cartogram of population in Nigeria",
       subtitle = "Administrative level 2 divisions") +
  xlab("Longitude") +
  ylab("Latitude") +
  scale_fill_continuous(name = "Population")
```

]
]

# Temperature

Mean maximum temperatures (for the years 1970-2000) in Nigeria

- Data : [`raster`](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/raster/index.html) R-package - from the [`WorldClim`](https://www.worldclim.org/) database

.panelset[
.panel[.panel-name[Map]

```{r temperature, out.height="300px", eval=T}
knitr::include_graphics("images/temperature.PNG", dpi = NA)
```

]
.panel[.panel-name[Code]

```{r temperature-code, eval = F, echo = T}
library(raster)
library(ggplot2)
library(magrittr)
library(sf)
library(rgeoboundaries)


# Downloading monthly maximum temperature data
tmax_data <- getData(name = "worldclim", var = "tmax", res = 10)

# Converting temperature values to Celcius
gain(tmax_data)=0.1

# Calculating mean of the monthly maximum temperatures
tmax_mean <- mean(tmax_data)

# Downloading the boundary of Nigeria
nigeria_sf <- geoboundaries("Nigeria")

# Extracting temperature data of Nigeria
tmax_mean_ngeria <- raster::mask(tmax_mean, as_Spatial(nigeria_sf))

# Converting the raster object into a dataframe
tmax_mean_nigeria_df <- as.data.frame(tmax_mean_ngeria, xy = TRUE, na.rm = TRUE)

tmax_mean_nigeria_df %>%
  ggplot(aes(x=x,y=y)) +
  geom_raster(aes(fill = layer)) +
  geom_sf(data = nigeria_sf, inherit.aes = FALSE, fill=NA) +
  labs(title = "Mean monthly maximum temperatures in Nigeria",
       subtitle = "For the years 1970-2000") +
  xlab("Longitude") +
  ylab("Latitude") +
  scale_fill_gradient(name = "Temperature (Â°C)",
                      low =  "#FEED99",
                      high = "#AF3301")
```

]
]

# Elevation

Country and lower level administrative divisions' land elevation data

- Data : [`elevatr`](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/elevatr/index.html) R-package

.panelset[
.panel[.panel-name[Map]

```{r elevation, out.height="300px", eval=T}
knitr::include_graphics("images/elevation.PNG", dpi = NA)
```

]
.panel[.panel-name[Code]

```{r elevation-code, eval = F, echo = T}
library(rnaturalearth)
library(rnaturalearthhires)
library(elevatr)
library(ggplot2)

sf_swiss <- ne_states(country = 'switzerland', returnclass='sf')

elevation_1 <- elevatr::get_elev_raster(locations = sf_swiss, z = 7,clip = "locations")
cropped_elev <- crop(elevation_1,sf_swiss)
elevate <- as.data.frame(cropped_elev,xy = TRUE)

colnames(elevate)[3] = "elevation_value"
elevate <- elevate[complete.cases(elevate),]

ggplot() +
  geom_raster(data = elevate , aes(x = x, y = y,fill = elevation_value )) +
  geom_sf(data = sf_swiss, color = "white", fill = NA) +
  coord_sf(xlim = c(5.3,10.8), ylim = c(45.5,47.8))+
  scale_fill_viridis_c()+
  ggtitle("Elevation data of Switzerland admininstrative areas")
```

]
]

# Rainfall

- Data : [`nasapower`](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/nasapower/index.html) R-package - from the [`NASA power project`](https://power.larc.nasa.gov/)

- `nasapower` package aims at making it quick and easy to automate downloading `NASA power` global meteorology, surface solar energy and climatology data

- We can get previous years data either *daily*,*interannual* and *climatology*(30 year period). 


# Malaria

Global Malaria Data(surveyed)

- Data : [`malariaAtlas`](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/malariaAtlas/index.html) R-package - from the [`Malaria Atlas Project`](https://malariaatlas.org/)

.panelset[
.panel[.panel-name[Map]

```{r malaria, out.height="300px", eval=T}
knitr::include_graphics("images/malaria.PNG", dpi = NA)
```

]
.panel[.panel-name[Code]

```{r malaria-code, eval = F, echo = T}
library(malariaAtlas)

IND_shp <- getShp(country = "India", admin_level = "admin0") # get shapefile
IND_shp_df <- as.MAPshp(IND_shp) # convert shapefile 
IND_an_dirus <- getRaster(surface = "Anopheles dirus species complex", shp = IND_shp) # get raster
IND_an_dirus_df <- as.MAPraster(IND_an_dirus) # convert raster
vec <- getVecOcc(country = c("India"), species = "Anopheles dirus") # get vector point data

p <- autoplot(IND_an_dirus_df, shp_df = IND_shp_df, printed = FALSE) # plot raster and shapefile
p[[1]] + geom_point(data = vec, aes(longitude, latitude), shape = 21,  show.legend = TRUE)+
  scale_fill_distiller(name = "Predicted distribution", palette = "YlOrRd")+
  ggtitle("Raw Vector Survey points + \nThe predicted distribution of Anohpeles dirus species complex")+
  theme(legend.position = "bottom")+
  theme_solarized()+
  labs(x = "Longitude", y = "Latitude")
```

]
]
